description: Erection of a new building on existing car park, comprising  six storeys (ground + 5, over existing basement), attached to refurbished building at front, with ground floor glazed infill to Taviton St frontage, with landscaped forecourt and courtyards, all to provide university administration, teaching, research and student support facilities.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - Details of the trees and/or shrubs in the front planter (including the planter) and in the rear sunken garden shown on the drawings hereby approved,  shall be submitted to and approved by the Council as the local planning authority before any works to the relvant part of the development is begun.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 EN61and EN35  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 and EN35  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design and method statement for all ground floor structures, foundations and other development proposed below ground level which takes account of the proposed running tunnels of the Cross Rail Project including any ground movements arising from the construction of the Cross Rail tunnels, and the effects of noise and vibration arising from the use of the running tunnels, have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All such works which form part of the design and method statements shall be completed before any part of the building is occupied.

Reason: So that the Council [and the Cross Rail Project Team] may be satisfied that the proposed Crossrail Project is adequately safeguarded, in accordance with the requirements of policy TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - Before the occupation of the development hereby permitted, the six cycle stands within the enclosure at the front of the building shall be provided and shall be permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Reason: In order to satisfactorily provide for cycle parking within the site in accordance with policy TR22 and DS8 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials specified in the approved application and sample board unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Council as the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
